Subject: HyperNEAT - force reevaluation of population
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=402390164; y=58Q2gp35mtW1VqpuYcaC31BjDoAYi7DhKIFgq9LHZBunDi9i3fwF
X-Yahoo-Profile: phareyouwell

I have a question for any of you that know the HyperNEAT code.  
Basically I am trying to incorporate changing environmental conditions 
into my algorithm such that when a certain criteria is met the 
environment I evaluate my evolved neural networks in is modified.  When 
this happens I  want to throw out the fitness of all the individuals in 
my population that were obtained from the old environment and force them 
to be reevaluated in the new environment.  Does anyone have a suggestion 
for how this can be done?

Thanks,
Josh
